text: Francesco Hayez (February 10, 1791, Venice – December 21, 1882, Milan) was the main artist of Romanticism in mid-19th-century in Milan. Notable works include: *Petro Rosso Imprisoned by the Scaligeri (c. 1820) *A series on the Sicilian Vespers (1821-1846) *Destruction of the Temple of Jerusalem (c. 1867) *Portrait of Marin Faliero
